software.Description: 100 Yen Disk 6 is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Onion Soft, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.name: 100 Yen Soft#7: Final Special

software.name: 100 Yen Soft#8: Revival Special
software.Description: 100 Yen Soft#8: Revival Special is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Tsukka Software, which was released in Japan in 1991.

software.name: A-Ressha de Ikou
software.Description: A-Ressha de Ikou is a Strategy game, developed and published by Artdink, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Abyss
software.Description: Far away from here, in a hidden gorge through the Mountian of the Golden Lion, lies the ofrgotten ABYSS. Forgotten, that is until now, when brave and sometimes foolhardy adventures strive to cross it. You are one of the elite band whose sole aim is to destroy the many evil monsters that lurk in the shadows, waiting for the next meal to come strolling across one of the many bridges in the ABYSS.

software.name: Abyss II: Tears of Emperor
software.Description: Abyss II: Tears of Emperor is an Adventure game, developed and published by Hummingbird Soft, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Angel Hearts
software.Description: Angel Hearts is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Elf, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.name: Argo
software.Description: Argo is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Kure, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Back to the Future
software.Description: You are Marty McFly, just a typical senior at Hill Valley High. But after getting behind the wheel of a nuclear-powered sports car turned time machine, you find yourself in the year 1955 where you've accidentally tampered with history. Now it must be corrected. You must somehow make sure that teenagers Lorraine Baines and George McFly (the two kids that will eventually grow up to become your parents) fall in love before the photo of your family fades away and you're left with nothing to come home to. It won't be easy. You'll have to protect George from Biff and his gang of bullies while doing your best to keep them from beating you up instead. To complicate things, Lorraine has a crush on you, so you'll have to dodge her advances while trying to figure out a way to get George and her to kiss at the school dance. Time is wasting and even if you manage to put all of the pieces in place, there is still no guarantee that you'll get back. It will all come down to one brief moment in time when the past, present and future all meet.

software.name: Balloon Fight
software.Description: You'll need lightning-fast reactions to win this battle in the sky! Take to the skies! It's BALLOON FIGHT! You'll score lots of points and have loads of fun when you burst enemy balloons and send their parachutes crashing into the sea. But beware. These hot-air invaders having an amazing ability to land safely, blow up another balloon and come back stronger than before! What's more, if you fly too low you'll be devoured by man-eating sharks! Challenge them alone if you think you're up to it, or team up with a friend. Either way, you'll have the time of your life fighting off your opponents in the sky and avoiding those hungry sharks below in BALLOON FIGHT!

software.name: Black Onyx, The
software.Description: The Black Onyx is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Bullet Proof Software, which was released in Japan in 1984.

software.name: Blade of Blackpoole, The
software.Description: The Blade of Blackpoole is an Adventure game, developed by Sirius Software and published by Starcraft, which was released in Japan in 1984.

software.name: Bomberman
software.Description: Bomberman arrives on the DS with a variety of gameplay modes, touch screen functionality, and voice support. Using only one game card, you and seven of your friends can lay bombs in different arenas rife with power-ups. In single-player mode, you can test your reflexes and strategies through 100 stages of challenging puzzles.

software.name: Cannonball Run II, The
software.Description: The Cannonball Run II is a Racing game, developed and published by Pony Canyon, which was released in Japan in 1984.

software.name: Chack'n Pop
software.Description: Chack'n Pop is an Action game, developed by Carry Lab. and published by Nidecom Soft, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Choplifter!
software.Description: Man a chopper in the nation's top action adventure. Pockets of international hostages are trapped. All across the world. In the Middle East. In the South Seas. And in a secret base somewhere in a cavern. You man a helicopter rescue team. And your job is to take your helicopter down, rescue the hostages and fly them back to safety. All the while dodging and destroying dangerous enemy fire. An action-packed helicopter game at its best!

software.name: Columns
software.Description: Drift back to ancient Phoenicia and challenge yourself with Columns, a game favored by middle eastern merchants. In this mesmerizing pastime, tinker with your riches to align glittering jewels across, down, or diagonally. As you line up colors, the gems vanish and more sparklers drop from above. The challenge increases as the jewels fall more rapidly. You must quickly align them before the columns reach the top. You don't have to be a joystick whiz to excel, even at the hardest levels. Try Flash Columns and make a flashing jewel disappear before time runs out. Enjoy solitary games, or play with a friend. Imagine yourself on the warm Mediterranean coast, or drifting over a languid sea. Forget the passage of time, and tickle your mind with Columns, the brilliant game of strategy and skill.

software.name: Computer City Zenon
software.Description: Computer City Zenon is an Action game, developed and published by Dempa Shinbunsha, which was released in Japan in 1983.

software.name: Craze
software.Description: Craze is an Action game, developed and published by Heart Denshi, which was released in Japan in 1988.

software.name: Crystal Prison
software.Description: Crystal Prison is an Adventure game, developed by Bothtec and published by Bosoft, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Daiva Story 1: Flames of Vlitra
software.Description: Daiva Story 1: Flames of Vlitra is a Strategy game, developed and published by T&E; Soft, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Demon Crystal, The
software.Description: The Demon Crystal is an Action game, developed and published by Dempa Shinbunsha, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Dennou Suikoden
software.Description: Dennou Suikoden is an Adventure game, developed and published by Hot-B, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Dezeni Land
software.Description: Dezeni Land is an Adventure game, developed and published by Hudson Soft, which was released in Japan in 1983.

software.name: Dezeni World
software.Description: Dezeni World is an Adventure game, developed and published by Hudson Soft, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Dinosaur
software.Description: Dinosaur is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Falcom, which was released in Japan in 1990.

software.Description: Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Falcom, which was released in Japan in 1989.

Release.name: Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes

ReleaseImages.Image: Dragon Slayer The Legend of Heroes (JP)-78899_front.jpg
Dragon Slayer The Legend of Heroes (JP)-78899_back.jpg

software.name: Duel
software.Description: Duel is a Strategy game, developed and published by Kure, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.name: Dynamite Bowl
software.Description: Dynamite Bowl is a Sports game, developed by Soft Vision International and published by Toshiba EMI, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Eidolon, The
software.Description: Discover the secrets of The Eidolon, a mysterious 19th century machine crafted of wood and brass, powered by the forces of magic. If you can control the engines of this ancient apparatus, an unseen world is yours to explore. The inventor of this strange device disappeared without a trace over 100 years ago but his sketches and notes describe an underground world populated by curious magical creatures and ferocious Guardian Dragons. Create and capture fireballs of magical energies which can transform them one into another. The powerful forces that propelled The Eidolon and its inventor into another dimension still pulse through its quaint frame, awaiting another daring adventurer to climb into the pilot's chair, touch the controls, and activate its power...

software.name: Elthlead
software.Description: Elthlead is a Strategy game, developed and published by NCS, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Escape from Rungistan
software.Description: Escape from Rungistan is an Adventure game, developed by Sirius Software and published by Starcraft, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Excitebike
software.Description: This thrilling Nintendo programmable game lets you vary the obstacles, change the sequence of events, and increase the racing challenge time and time again! You'll start out in a Nintendo designed preliminary race, and move through a series of increasingly difficult challenge races! You'll face crazy curves, hairpin turns, daredevil jumps, and some very fierce motorcross competition, as you race your bike towards the checkered flag. This thrilling test of driving strategy and skill will keep you riveted to the screen for hours!

software.name: F-15 Strike Eagle
software.Description: Strap into your ejection seat and get ready for challenging and exciting modern jet fighter combat with F-15 Strike Eagle! Fly combat missions, engage enemy aircraft, and destroy enemy ground targets in the skies of Southeast Asia, Europe and the Middle East. All the sophisticated tools of modern electronic air warfare are available including computer assisted targeting, heads-up display, airborne radar and ground tracking target display maps.

software.name: Fire Hawk: Thexder The Second Contact
software.Description: Fire Hawk: Thexder The Second Contact is an Action game, developed and published by Game Arts, which was released in Japan in 1989.

Release.name: Fire Hawk: Thexder The Second Contact

ReleaseImages.Image: Fire Hawk Thexder The Second Contact (JP)-88310_front.jpg

software.name: Funhouse Mystery
software.Description: Funhouse Mystery is an Adventure game, developed and published by Starcraft, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Gai Flame
software.Description: Gai Flame is a Strategy game, developed and published by NCS, which was released in Japan in 1990.

software.name: Gaia no Monshou
software.Description: Gaia no Monshou is a Strategy game, developed and published by NCS, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Gandhara: Buddha no Seisen
software.Description: Gandhara: Buddha no Seisen is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Enix Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Golf
software.Description: Golf is a Sports game, developed by Nintendo and published by Hudson Soft, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Goonies, The
software.Description: The Goonies is an Action game, developed and published by Konami, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Gradius
software.Description: You are the last hope of the gentle people of Gradius. You've just lifted off to confront the all-out attack of the amoeboid Bacterions. Your hyper-space fighter is armed with the greatest arsenal in the galaxy. Air-to-surface and double beam laser cannons for incredible firepower. Powerful force fields for protection. Time and space warps for fleeing the dimension. You'll need it all just to survive. Because at the heart of the Bacterion Empire lies the Xaerous Superfortress - the nerve center of the all-knowing, all-seeing Bacterion Bio-Computer. It's a duel to the death, while the entire galaxy watches, waits, and hopes!

software.name: Grobda
software.Description: Grobda is an Action game, developed by Namco and published by Dempa Shinbunsha, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Hokuto no Ken: Violence Gekiga Adventure
software.Description: Hokuto no Ken: Violence Gekiga Adventure is an Action game, developed and published by Enix Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1986.

Release.name: Hokuto no Ken: Violence Gekiga Adventure

software.name: Hole in One
software.Description: Hole in One is a Sports game, developed and published by HAL Labs, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Hydlide II: Shine of Darkness
software.Description: Hydlide II: Shine of Darkness is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by T&E; Soft, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Ice Climber
software.Description: If you can break through 8 levels of treacherous arctic ice, you'll reach the top of the mountain! But watch out. The Nitpickers, Condors, and Ploar Bears don't want you up there. And they've got a bag of tricks that will test every ounce of your strength and courage. Are you going to let them stop you? No way! There are 32 mountains to choose from and endless thrills as you fight these arctic creatures alone or with a friend, and ascend to the top of the mountain in ICE CLIMBER!

software.name: J.B. Harold 3: D.C. Connection
software.Description: J.B. Harold 3: D.C. Connection is an Adventure game, developed and published by Riverhillsoft, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.name: Jack Nicklaus' Greatest 18 Holes of Major Championship Golf
software.Description: Hackers beware! You're about to tee off on a course so challenging that it would've had history's greatest golfers trembling in their knickers. Handpicked by the master himself, 18 of the greatest holes in golf have now been linked together, including the 14th at St. Andrews, 18th at Muirfield, and 12th at Royal Lytham. All the elements of the major championships are here as well - the harsh winds of Scotland, the lightning fast greens of Augusta, Oakmont's death traps and the great ocean hazard at Pebble Beach. Trees are everywhere. Birdies are few. And it has more doglegs than a kennel. Even pin placements change from round to round, making double bogeys as common as pars. Up to a foursome can compete, or you can go it alone against a computerized Golden Bear. You also have the option of playing a skins game or stroke play. So get a grip on yourself. Then swing into action on a course as legendary as the man who designed it.

Release.name: Jack Nicklaus' Greatest 18 Holes of Major Championship Golf

ReleaseImages.Image: Jack Nicklaus' Greatest 18 Holes of Major Championship Golf (JP)-571425_front.jpg

software.name: JESUS II
software.Description: JESUS II is an Adventure game, developed and published by Enix Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1991.

software.name: King Flappy
software.Description: King Flappy is a Puzzle game, developed and published by DB Soft, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: King's Knight Special
software.Description: King's Knight Special is an Action game, developed and published by SquareSoft, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Kiss of Murder
software.Description: Kiss of Murder is an Adventure game, developed and published by Riverhillsoft, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Knither
software.Description: Knither is an Action game, developed and published by Dempa Shinbunsha, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Labyrinth
software.Description:
We've been watching you...
We know all about you. We know your weaknesses. Weaknesses that have made you our thrall. To regain your freedom you must find the castle at the heart of the Labyrinth. If you are unable to break the spell within 13 hours, you will be lost forever. Which, for your information, is a very long time...
A key. Popcorn, A move ticket. Everyday objects have a way of taking on a whole new meaning once you enter the Labyrinth. Be prepared for anything. A wall of hands, talking door-knockers, or a friend in need. There will be goblins at every turn. Only one thing's for certain; we can't be held responsible if you get lost.

software.name: Laptick
software.Description: Laptick is an Action game, developed and published by DB Soft, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Las Vegas
software.Description: Las Vegas is an Adventure game, developed and published by Starcraft, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Law of the West
software.Description: Law of the West is an Adventure game, developed by Accolade and published by Pony Canyon, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Lode Runner
software.Description: You're a highly trained Galactic Commando, deep in enemy territory. Your mission: to recover a fortune in gold, stolen from the Bungeling people by their power-hungry leaders. You'll be running, jumping, and climbing heroically, solving perplexing puzzles. With your laser pistol, you'll drill passageways through stone floors and barriers. To get through this mission alive, you'll need more than fleet feet and good looks. You'll need your quick wits and brains. And more than just a little luck.

software.name: Lunar Ball
software.Description: Lunar Ball is a Sports game, developed by Compile and published by Pony Canyon, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Macadam
software.Description: Macadam is a Simulation game, developed and published by Macadamia, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Manhattan Requiem
software.Description: Manhattan... A city of greed. The untimely demise of Sarah Shields, a bar pianist who jumped to her death from her apartment window, was nothing uncommon in the hustle and bustle of this never-slowing city. After all, what's one more suicide? Or was it? Now, as the unexpected emerges, truths and half-truths emerge one after another. J.B. Harold is back walking the streets, seeking the clues which have remained hidden... Now you are in command as the hero, conducting the investigation like the pro you are. Solve the riddle, as easy as unraveling tangled thread, as you search for the facts behind Sarah's death in "Manhattan Requiem."

software.name: Mari-chan Kiki Ippatsu
software.Description: Mari-chan Kiki Ippatsu is an Action game, developed and published by Enix Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1983.

software.name: Mario Bros. Special
software.Description: Mario Bros. Special is an Action game, developed and published by Hudson, which was released in Japan in 1984.

software.name: Masquerade
software.Description: Masquerade is an Adventure game, developed and published by Starcraft, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Mirrors
software.Description: Mirrors is an Adventure game, developed and published by Wing, which was released in Japan in 1990.

software.name: Murder Club
software.Description:
The mystery begins with a stream of blood runninng down Bil Robbins' back. Now its up to you, J.B., to track down the culprit whose hand twisted the knife. Enemies? The victim had so many, they must have been standing in line to bump him off. But the murderer will never get away because the amazing technology of TurboGrafx-CD will make all suspects answer to you as you grill them and dig up clues. Unravel a dark world of chilling secrets, hidden mysteries, sultry dames and deceit to crack the case. Yeah, J.B., everyone has something to hide. Don't let them hide it from you!
"The graphics are sharp...the original music score is excellent." - GamePro

software.name: NEC PC88
software.Description: NEC PC88 is a Hardware game, developed and published by NEC, which was released in Japan in 1981.

software.name: Old Village Story, The
software.Description: The Old Village Story is an Adventure game, developed and published by Enix Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1988.

software.name: Pachicom
software.Description: Pachicom is a Miscellaneous game, developed by Shouei and published by Toshiba EMI, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Popful Mail: Magical Fantasy Adventure
software.Description: Popful Mail: Magical Fantasy Adventure is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Falcom, which was released in Japan in 1991.

software.name: Produce
software.Description: Produce is a Strategy game, developed and published by DB Soft, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Punch Ball Mario Bros.
software.Description: Punch Ball Mario Bros. is an Action game, developed and published by Hudson, which was released in Japan in 1984.

software.Description: Rogue Alliance is an Action game, developed and published by Starcraft, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.Description: Sadistic Gamers Part 1 - Kateikyoushi Play is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Sixteens, which was released in Japan in 1988.

software.name: Sadistic Gamers Part 2 - Otanjoubi Play
software.Description: Sadistic Gamers Part 2 - Otanjoubi Play is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Sixteens, which was released in Japan in 1988.

software.Description: Sakusaku Dai Goutou is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by A-Inn, which was released in Japan in 1991.

software.name: Scheme, The
software.Description: The Scheme is an Action Adventure game, developed by Onion Soft and published by Bothtec, which was released in Japan in 1988.

software.name: Screamer, The
software.Description: The Screamer is a Role-Playing game, developed by Magical Zoo and published by ASCII Entertainment, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: SeeNa
software.Description: SeeNa is an Action game, developed by TINYAN and published by SystemSoft, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Shanghai II
software.Description: Shanghai II is a Puzzle game, developed and published by SystemSoft, which was released in Japan in 1990.

software.name: Shikinjou
software.Description: Shikinjou is a Puzzle game, developed and published by Scaptrust, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.name: Shiryou Sensen: War of the Dead
software.Description: Shiryou Sensen: War of the Dead is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Victor Interactive Software, which was released in Japan in 1989.

Release.name: Shiryou Sensen: War of the Dead

software.name: Shiryou Sensen: War of the Dead Part 2

Release.name: Shiryou Sensen: War of the Dead Part 2

software.name: Silpheed
software.Description: The earth-based "Grayzon" computer defense system has been 'net-jacked'. Mankind's future in space is in your hands! This highly modified SA-77 "Silpheed" tactical fighter spacecraft is up to the challenge... are you? The best space-shooter ever, 11 fast, tough, action-filled battle stages. Amazingly detailed polygon graphics and CD quality music and sound. Left and right main weapons, plus choice of optional weapons systems: Graviton Bomb, EM Defense System, Photon Torpedo or Anti-Matter Bomb.

software.name: Silver Ghost
software.Description: Silver Ghost is a Strategy game, developed and published by Kure, which was released in Japan in 1988.

software.name: Snatcher
software.Description: A.D. 2047. Neo Kobe City, Japan, a place of madness and decadence... A mysterious Bio-roid life form has appeared. Its true nature and purpose are unknown. Is it some country's secret weapon, or an alien from another world? They slay their victims and take their place, earning them the nickname "SNATCHERS." A new police division - J.U.N.K.E.R.s - has been formed. They are trained specifically to combat the SNATCHERS. The fate of mankind hangs in the balance. The war between the SNATCHERS and J.U.N.K.E.R.s has begun!

software.name: Sorcerian
software.Description: Sorcerian is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Falcom, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Soukoban
software.Description: Soukoban is a Puzzle game, developed and published by Thinking Rabbit, which was released in Japan in 1982.

software.name: Soukoban 2
software.Description: Soukoban 2 is a Puzzle game, developed and published by Thinking Rabbit, which was released in Japan in 1984.

software.name: Soukoban Perfect
software.Description: Soukoban Perfect is a Puzzle game, developed and published by Thinking Rabbit, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.name: Star Trader
software.Description: Star Trader is an Action game, developed and published by Falcom, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.name: Still Sword for Adult
software.Description: Still Sword for Adult is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Fairy Tale, which was released in Japan in 1988.

software.name: Story of Melroon, The
software.Description: The Story of Melroon is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by DB Soft, which was released in Japan in 1989.

software.name: Suikoden: Tenmei no Chikai
software.Description: Join history's greatest band of robbers - The Bandit Kings of the Song Empire! The year is 1101 and the evil minister Gao Qiu has seized all Imperial authority! The Emperor has one last chance to restore the glory of days past - a desperate gamble to find the last great hero in China! As a Bandit King, make allies and conquer territories. Watch out for typhoons, riots, epidemics, desertions and attacks from wild beasts. Enjoy festivals with your loyal band of heroes. Gain the support of the people and receive the benefits of their favor. But stay alert... in the end, who will be victorious? You or Gao Qiu?

software.name: Super Mario Bros. Special
software.Description: Super Mario Bros. Special is an Action game, developed and published by Hudson Soft, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Super Zenon: Defender Force Gamma5
software.Description: Super Zenon: Defender Force Gamma5 is an Action game, developed by Kure and published by Dempa Shinbunsha, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Tennis
software.Description: Slam a serve, fire a blazing backhand, smash a forehand volley... you call the shots in Nintendo TENNIS! Nintendo lets you choose an opponent from five different skill levels, so as your game improves, so does your playing partner! Plus, you can actually gauge the speed of your serve! The better your timing, the faster it moves across the net. You'll have hours of fun rushing the net, playing the baseline or roaming the court. With Nintendo's state-of-the-art graphics and realistic game play, you'll really believe you're at center court!

software.name: Tetris
software.Description: The Soviet game sensation is now on your Game Boy! Beams, boxes, zig-zags and L-shaped blocks drop down a narrow passage. Feel your pulse quicken as you spin, shift and align the shapes for a perfect fit. It's challenging and demands split-second decision making! Start at new heights for a tougher contest. Pick the music and set your pace from 20 progressive skill levels!

software.name: Time Zone
software.Description: Time Zone is an Action game, developed by Sierra Entertainment and published by Starcraft, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Transylvania II
software.Description: Transylvania II is an Adventure game, developed by Polarware and published by Starcraft, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: Ultima III: Exodus
software.Description: Upon escaping the crumbling ruins of Shadowguard, the black fortress of Minax, you lay your weary body on the now-sacred ground. As you rest, you remember your first encounter with the evil wizard of Mondain, whom you later tracked down and destroyed. The existence of his apprentice, Minax, was soon revealed and the crusade was begun again. Younger and more cunning than her mentor, she has been much more difficult to vanquish. But now your sense of accomplishment is touched by a chilling fear. Have all vestiges of evil been removed? Somehow, you sense that your treacherous foes have not been eliminated. Without further feats of skill, daring and perseverance, all of your past accomplishments may be lost. You stand up, prepare your armor, and walk to the dimension door. Stepping in, the hunt resumes.

software.name: Veigues Tactical Gladiator
software.Description: For 3 years, alien invaders have been pounding the earth into a smoldering ruin. There isn't a man alive who can stop them. But now there's Veigues, a devastating fighting machine! Built with captured enemy technology, he's our last desperate hope for survival... and you're in control! Trash the invaders with the Plazma Cannon! Just keep your firepower hot and fight like there's no tomorrow. Destroy the aliens or there won't be!

software.name: Volguard
software.Description: Volguard is an Action game, developed and published by DB Soft, which was released in Japan in 1984.

software.name: Warning
software.Description: Warning is an Action game, developed and published by Cosmos Computer, which was released in Japan in 1987.

software.name: Winter Games
software.Description: It's all here - the strategy, the challenge, the competition and the pageantry of the Winter Games. Compete against a friend or take on the computer in four completely realistic and action-packed events. Choose the country you want to represent. Then practice, train and develop the winning strategy for each competition... Speed Skating in a grueling race on ice. Hot Dog Aerials for daredevils on skis. Figure Skating to test balance, stamina and precision. Bobsled, where every screaming turn could mean the difference between wiping out and winning gold. Your adrenaline and heart are racing. Let the games begin!

software.name: Woody Poco
software.Description: Woody Poco is an Action game, developed and published by DB Soft, which was released in Japan in 1986.

software.name: World Golf
software.Description: World Golf is a Sports game, developed and published by Enix Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1985.

software.name: Xak II: Rising of the Redmoon
software.Description: Xak II: Rising of the Redmoon is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Micro Cabin, which was released in Japan in 1990.

Release.name: Xak II: Rising of the Redmoon

ReleaseImages.Image: Xak II Rising of the Redmoon (JP)-83561_front.jpg

software.name: Xak Precious Package: The Tower of Gazzel
software.Description: Xak Precious Package: The Tower of Gazzel is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Micro Cabin, which was released in Japan in 1991.

software.name: Xak: The Art of Visual Stage

software.name: Ys III: Wanderers from Ys
software.Description: As Adol, hero of Ys Book I & II, your most fearsome new adventure is about to begin! The curse of the monster Demanicus terrorizes your friend Dogi's homeland. Chaos rules as blood-thirsty creatures threaten innocent lives. Only you have the courage and strength to defeat them! Gather your fiercest swords and deadly amulet to battle these horrific creatures with a thrilling new action view. Survive the fiery depths of Alcaino. Conquer the terrifying Nekevil. But stay alert, brave Adol! The fury of Demanicus awaits your final epic struggle!
